page.title: 06GEDDINGTON'S NEW ARRIVALS
page.content: Most of the new arrivals moved to Geddington to take up work in the area. The village was chosen by some because it has its own school, albeit small. It is an ideal place for children. The new arrivals were usually made to feel at home and settled in rapidly. Others missed the company of close friends left behind. All the new residents are glad they came to live in Geddington, praising the friendly atmosphere and the Village Hall leisure complex for lectures, keep-fit, badminton, tennis and bowls. Many looked forward to the opening of the new school with its increase in facilities. Some mentioned that they would like the school to be larger.
